text.div:
Address Logical Model

An address expressed using postal conventions (as opposed to GPS or other location definition formats). This data type may be used to convey addresses for use in delivering mail as well as for visiting locations and which might not be valid for mail delivery. There are a variety of postal address formats defined around the world. (Source: HL7 FHIR).

name: Address
title: shr-core-Address
description: An address expressed using postal conventions (as opposed to GPS or other location definition formats). This data type may be used to convey addresses for use in delivering mail as well as for visiting locations and which might not be valid for mail delivery. There are a variety of postal address formats defined around the world. (Source: HL7 FHIR).

element.definition: An address expressed using postal conventions (as opposed to GPS or other location definition formats). This data type may be used to convey addresses for use in delivering mail as well as for visiting locations and which might not be valid for mail delivery. There are a variety of postal address formats defined around the world. (Source: HL7 FHIR).

element.short: Description of the intent or use of the item.
element.definition: Description of the intent or use of the item.

element.short: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.
element.definition: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.

element.short: A string meant for reading by a person, for example, accompanying a code.
element.definition: A string meant for reading by a person, for example, accompanying a code.

element.short: Part of an address that contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information. (Source: HL7 FHIR).
element.definition: Part of an address that contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information. (Source: HL7 FHIR).

element.short: The name of a municipality, city, town, village or other community or delivery center. (Source: HL7 FHIR).
element.definition: The name of a municipality, city, town, village or other community or delivery center. (Source: HL7 FHIR).

element.short: The name of the administrative area at a level below that of a state but above that of a city or town. In the US, a county. Outside the US, a district or the equivalent. (Source: HL7 FHIR).
element.definition: The name of the administrative area at a level below that of a state but above that of a city or town. In the US, a county. Outside the US, a district or the equivalent. (Source: HL7 FHIR).

element.short: Sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (i.e. US 2 letter state codes). (Source: HL7 FHIR).
element.definition: Sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (i.e. US 2 letter state codes). (Source: HL7 FHIR).

element.short: A sequence of letters and digits used as part of a postal address, often designating a geographic region
element.definition: A sequence of letters and digits used as part of a postal address, often designating a geographic region

element.short: Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted, expressed in ISO 3166 Alpha-2 (2-letter) codes.
element.definition: Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted, expressed in ISO 3166 Alpha-2 (2-letter) codes.

element.short: The date and time span for which something is active, valid, or in force.
element.definition: The date and time span for which something is active, valid, or in force.
